summary: This document is a series of daily staff assignment rosters for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering August 8-10, 2019. It details shift assignments, officer postings, leave statuses (sick/annual), and overtime records for correctional staff. The rosters show routine prison staffing operations during the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there. This document appears to be a detailed staff roster or shift change log for a correctional facility, dated August 10, 2019. It lists officer assignments, reliefs, sick/annual leave, and overtime for various units and posts, including SHU (Special Housing Unit), control rooms, and visitation areas.

keyFacts: The document is a routine prison staff assignment roster from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 8-10, 2019.
It shows detailed shift schedules, post assignments (e.g., SHU, LOBBY, CONTROL), and leave statuses (Sick Leave, Annual Leave) for correctional officers.
Two named correctional officers, Thomas, M and Noel, T, are identified in the rosters.
The document provides insight into the standard operational staffing of the facility during the time Jeffrey Epstein was held there.
No direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any unusual incidents are present in this administrative document.
The document is a staff roster/log for a correctional facility dated Saturday, August 10, 2019.
It tracks detailed shift changes, officer reliefs, sick leave, annual leave, and overtime occurrences.
Specific posts mentioned include SHU (Special Housing Unit), control rooms, visitation areas, and a dry cell.
Officers are identified by initials or last names (e.g., Noel, T; Thomas M) in the context of assignments and leave.
The log indicates a total of 116 Correctional Services staff and 7 Non-Correctional Services staff for the period covered.
